original_text: On the diophantine equation x/sup 2/+q/sup 2k+1/=y/sup n/ In this paper it has been proved that if q is an odd prime, q not=7 (mod 8), n is an odd integer >or=5, n is not a multiple of 3 and (h, n)=1, where h is the class number of the filed Q( square root (-q)), then the diophantine equation x/sup 2/+q/sup 2k+1/=y/sup n/ has exactly two families of solutions (q, n, k, x, y)
original_translation: En la ecuación diophantina x/sup 2/+q/sup 2k+1/=y/sup n/ En este artículo se ha demostrado que si q es un primo impar, q not=7 (mod 8), n es un entero impar >or=5, n no es un múltiplo de 3 y (h, n)=1, donde h es el número de clase de la Q(raíz cuadrada (
